newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Senate panel backs Klein as antitrust chief.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Senate panel backs Klein as antitrust chief.

text.p: The Senate Judiciary Committee Thursday approved Joel Klein to be assistant attorney general in charge of the Justice Department's antitrust division.
The committee acted unanimously to send Klein's nomination to the full Senate for confirmation. Klein has been acting antitrust chief since Anne Bingaman resigned last November.

Committee Chairman Orrin Hatch, R-Utah, called Klein a superb lawyer and added, "It is clear both from his speeches and his enforcement decisions that Mr. Klein is within the mainstream of antitrust law and doctrine and will be a stabilizing influence at the antitrust division."
Sen. Edward Kennedy, D-Massachusetts, said Klein's record and background demonstrated that he was extremely well qualified for the post.
